page.title: 15AN INTERESTING PERSON
page.content: Barney Everett Sebert Smith has lived in this area and in the same house since 1955. He was born in the village of Kessingland in 1911. When 14 he went to sea on a drifter. His father and grandfather were also {fishermen}. At 15 he went to the Shetland Is. for 12 weeks on a steam drifter as cook. He earned 10/- a week and a half share. From cook he graduated to deck hand, to mate and, at the age of 21 to skipper. During World War II he served at Dover and Sheerness as the skipper of a converted trawler, sweeping for mines. After the war he returned to fishing and became fishing skipper of the M.A.F.F. research vessel Sir Lancelot. Later he became a ship's husband. His last job was as a net fixer with a Lowestoft firm. He is now aged 74 and still regularly uses a longshore boat from Pakefield Beach.
